details: “S” is the nineteenth letter of the modern English alphabet. It represents the /s/ sound, as in 'sun'. The letter 'S' is often found in words related to shapes, sizes, and speed.

wordsData.definition: the star around which the Earth orbits, providing light and warmth
wordsData.example: The sun is shining brightly today.

wordsData.definition: a luminous point in the night sky, visible from Earth
wordsData.example: We saw many stars while camping.
The snake slithered through the grass.

wordsData.definition: a large boat used for traveling on water
wordsData.example: The ship sailed across the ocean.

rhymes.name: S is for Sun (to the tune of 'Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star')
content: S is for sun, so warm and bright,
Lighting up the sky so blue,
S is for sun, we love you!

rhymes.name: S is for Snake (to the tune of 'If You’re Happy and You Know It')
content: S is for snake, it slithers by,
With its scales and winding tail,
S is for snake, in the grass it’ll sail!
